page.title: 07Wood Ants in Blean Woods
page.content:
Blean Woods are the home for our largest native ant FORMICA RUFA and their enormous nests can be seen and avoided. The nests can be as much as six feet across and several feet high.
If the ants are disturbed for example by throwing a stick on the nest, the noise of rustling bodies and the tremendous activity can be quite frightening. Needless to say, small boys love doing this.
The ants are up to 1/2 inch long and a bite can be very painful. They do a useful job in the woodland, beaking down waste branches, leaves and dead creatures.
